title: CloseSocket regression in 8.13.0 on Solaris
body:
### I did this

(from Dagobert Michelsen via email)

~~~
I have a regression on Solaris 10 Sparc:

gmake[1]: Entering directory
'/home/dam/mgar/pkg/curl/trunk/work/solaris10-sparc/build-isa-sparcv8plus-features-minimal/curl
-8.13.0/src'
/bin/bash ../libtool  --tag=CC   --mode=link /opt/SUNWspro/bin/cc  -xO3 -m32 -xarch=sparc
-L/opt/csw/lib -L/opt/csw/lib -L/opt/csw/lib -L/opt/csw/lib -L/opt/csw/lib -o curl
curl-slist_wc.o curl-terminal.o curl-tool_bname.o curl-tool_cb_dbg.o curl-tool_cb_hdr.o
curl-tool_cb_prg.o curl-tool_cb_rea.o curl-tool_cb_see.o curl-tool_cb_soc.o curl-tool_cb_wrt.o
curl-tool_cfgable.o curl-tool_dirhie.o curl-tool_doswin.o curl-tool_easysrc.o
curl-tool_filetime.o curl-tool_findfile.o curl-tool_formparse.o curl-tool_getparam.o
curl-tool_getpass.o curl-tool_help.o curl-tool_helpers.o curl-tool_ipfs.o curl-tool_libinfo.o
curl-tool_listhelp.o curl-tool_main.o curl-tool_msgs.o curl-tool_operate.o curl-tool_operhlp.o
curl-tool_paramhlp.o curl-tool_parsecfg.o curl-tool_progress.o curl-tool_setopt.o
curl-tool_sleep.o curl-tool_ssls.o curl-tool_stderr.o curl-tool_strdup.o curl-tool_urlglob.o
curl-tool_util.o curl-tool_vms.o curl-tool_writeout.o curl-tool_writeout_json.o
curl-tool_xattr.o curl-var.o ../lib/curl-base64.o ../lib/curl-curl_multibyte.o
../lib/curl-dynbuf.o ../lib/curl-nonblock.o ../lib/curl-strparse.o ../lib/curl-strcase.o
../lib/curl-timediff.o ../lib/curl-timeval.o ../lib/curl-version_win32.o ../lib/curl-warnless.o
curl-tool_hugehelp.o curl-tool_ca_embed.o    ../lib/libcurl.la -lidn2 -lpsl -lssl -lcrypto
-lssl -lcrypto -lzstd -lz -lrt -lsocket -lnsl 
libtool: link: /opt/SUNWspro/bin/cc -xO3 -m32 -xarch=sparc -o .libs/curl curl-slist_wc.o
curl-terminal.o curl-tool_bname.o curl-tool_cb_dbg.o curl-tool_cb_hdr.o curl-tool_cb_prg.o
curl-tool_cb_rea.o curl-tool_cb_see.o curl-tool_cb_soc.o curl-tool_cb_wrt.o curl-tool_cfgable.o
curl-tool_dirhie.o curl-tool_doswin.o curl-tool_easysrc.o curl-tool_filetime.o
curl-tool_findfile.o curl-tool_formparse.o curl-tool_getparam.o curl-tool_getpass.o
curl-tool_help.o curl-tool_helpers.o curl-tool_ipfs.o curl-tool_libinfo.o curl-tool_listhelp.o
curl-tool_main.o curl-tool_msgs.o curl-tool_operate.o curl-tool_operhlp.o curl-tool_paramhlp.o
curl-tool_parsecfg.o curl-tool_progress.o curl-tool_setopt.o curl-tool_sleep.o curl-tool_ssls.o
curl-tool_stderr.o curl-tool_strdup.o curl-tool_urlglob.o curl-tool_util.o curl-tool_vms.o
curl-tool_writeout.o curl-tool_writeout_json.o curl-tool_xattr.o curl-var.o
../lib/curl-base64.o ../lib/curl-curl_multibyte.o ../lib/curl-dynbuf.o ../lib/curl-nonblock.o
../lib/curl-strparse.o ../lib/curl-strcase.o ../lib/curl-timediff.o ../lib/curl-timeval.o
../lib/curl-version_win32.o ../lib/curl-warnless.o curl-tool_hugehelp.o curl-tool_ca_embed.o
-L/opt/csw/lib ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so -lidn2 -lpsl -lssl -lcrypto -lzstd -lz -lrt -lsocket
-lnsl -R/opt/csw/lib
Undefined                       first referenced
 symbol                             in file
CloseSocket                         ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so
ld: fatal: symbol referencing errors. No output written to .libs/curl
gmake[1]: *** [Makefile:1027: curl] Error 1

~~~

Snippet from config.log:
~~~
configure:36261: checking if CloseSocket is compilable
configure:36280: /opt/SUNWspro/bin/cc -c -xO3 -m32 -xarch=sparc -I/opt/csw/include
-I/opt/csw/include    -I/opt/csw/include   -I/opt/csw/include   -I/opt/csw/include   conftest.c
>&5
"conftest.c", line 157: warning: implicit function declaration: CloseSocket
configure:36280: $? = 0
configure:36283: result: yes
configure:36297: checking if CloseSocket usage allowed
configure:36300: result: yes
configure:36310: checking if CloseSocket might be used
configure:36314: result: yes
~~~


### I expected the following

Previous version 8.12.1 worked fine.

### curl/libcurl version

8.13.0

### operating system

Solaris 10 Sparc
